Constructor Detail

Profiler

public Profiler()
Create a Profiler and set the internal timestamp to now. The Profiler will start measuring immediately.

Profiler

public Profiler(int expectedTotal)
Create a Profiler and set the internal timestamp to now. The Profiler will start measuring immediately.

Parameters:
expectedTotal - the expected total, used for ETA-calculations.

Profiler

public Profiler(int expectedTotal,
                int bpsSpan)
Create a Profiler and set the internal timestamp to now. The Profiler will start measuring immediately.

Parameters:
expectedTotal - the expected total, used for ETA-calculations.
bpsSpan - the number of stored beat-timestamps. See setBpsSpan(int) for explanation.
Method Detail

getBeats

public long getBeats()
Get the number of beats.

Returns:
the total number of beats

setBeats

public void setBeats(long value)
Sets the number of beats. Any negative value is converted to 0.

Parameters:
value - The number of beats in the queue

getExpectedTotal

public long getExpectedTotal()
Get the expected total number of beats.

Returns:
the expected total number of beats

setExpectedTotal

public void setExpectedTotal(long value)
Set the expected total number of beats. Values belov 0 are converted to 0.

Parameters:
value - the expected total number of beats.

getBpsSpan

public int getBpsSpan()
The bpsSpan is used for calculating the beats per second. The span is the maximum number of beats that are remembered. A value of 0 disables bps updating.

Returns:
the bpsSpan

setBpsSpan

public void setBpsSpan(int value)
The bpsSpan is used for calculating the beats per second. The span is the maximum number of beats that are remembered. A value of 0 disables bps updating. A value of 1 is changed to 2, as bps cannot be calculated from a list of length 1.

Parameters:
value - the bpsSpan

reset

public void reset()
Reset the ProgressFeedback, setting the internal timestamp to now, clearing the beats and the queue.

beat

public long beat()
Update ProgressFeedback with a single beat.

Returns:
the total number of beats

queueSize

public int queueSize()
Internal calculations.

Returns:
the size of the queue holding the most recent beats

getBps

public double getBps()
Convenience method for getBps(false).

Returns:
the number of beats per second averaged over the whole run.

getBps

public double getBps(boolean useCurrentSpeed)
Bps is the number of beats per second.

Parameters:
useCurrentSpeed - use the last bpsSpan beats to calculate the bps, thus giving a current speed estimate
Returns:
the number of beats per second for the last bpsSpan, NaN if it is incalculable

getSpendMilliseconds

public long getSpendMilliseconds()
The amount of time since creation or reset.

Returns:
the number of milliseconds this ProgressFeedback has been running

getSpendTime

public java.lang.String getSpendTime()
The amount of time since creation or reset.

Returns:
the spend time as a string

millisecondsToString

public static java.lang.String millisecondsToString(long ms)
Helper method for providing human-readable time.

Parameters:
ms - milliseconds
Returns:
human-readable time

getTimeLeft

public long getTimeLeft(boolean useCurrentSpeed)
The estimated number of milliseconds, before the task is completed. Requires expectedTotal to be more than 0.

Parameters:
useCurrentSpeed - use the bpsSpan for the estimate, thus basing it on current speed
Returns:
milliseconds before the task should be completed. -1 if it cannot be calculated

getTimeLeftAsString

public java.lang.String getTimeLeftAsString(boolean useCurrentSpeed)
Request the time left using GetTimeLeft and format the result using millisecondstoString. This is a convenience method.

Parameters:
useCurrentSpeed - use the bpsSpan for the estimate, thus basing it on current speed
Returns:
human-readable time left before the task should be completed. "N/A" if incalculable, "None" the task should be completed at call-time

getETA

public java.util.Calendar getETA(boolean useCurrentSpeed)
Calculate the extimated time of arrival.

Parameters:
useCurrentSpeed - use the bpsSpan for the estimate, thus basing it on current speed
Returns:
the extimated time of arrival, null if it is incalculable

getETAAsString

public java.lang.String getETAAsString(boolean useCurrentSpeed)
Request the ETA using getETA and format the result as YYYY-MM-DD HH:mm:SS.

Parameters:
useCurrentSpeed - use the bpsSpan for the estimate, thus basing it on current speed
Returns:
the extimated time of arrival, "N/A" if it is incalculable

pause

public void pause()
Pause the Profiler. Call unpause() in order to continue. Calling beat() will automatically unpause.

Note: The larger the bpsSpan, the longer it takes to unpause.

unpause

public void unpause()
